alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:57AM CDT until April 05 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT FOR CHOCTAW...NORTHERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN CLARKE... NORTHWESTERN WILCOX AND SOUTHEASTERN WAYNE COUNTIES... At 856 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Myrtlewood to 3 miles northeast of Millry to near Buckatunna, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Thomasville, Butler, Grove Hill, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Leroy, Pine Hill, Millry, Buckatunna, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Fulton, Gilbertown and Toxey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
